analyzed: su nikkhitta vagga  aneka vaṇṇa vimāna vatthu
translated: The Divine Mansion with Many Colors

analyzed: aneka vaṇṇam dara soka nāsana  vimānam āruyha anekacitta
translated: “Having ascended your divine mansion with many colors,🔽with many thoughts, a place of beauty, sorrow, and joy,
surrounded by a group of celestial nymphs,
Sunidha, you delight like the lord of the bhūtas.
There is no equal to you, let alone anyone greater,
in fame, merit, and success.
All the gods of the Thirty-three gathered together
pay homage to you, as the gods do to the moon.
And these celestial nymphs all around
dance, sing, and delight you.
You have attained the divine powers and are of great influence.
What merit did you make as a human?
By what are you so radiant

analyzed: vaṇṇaḥ ca te sabbadisā pabhāsati iti
translated: and your beauty shines in all directions?”
The god, pleased,
this is the result of that deed.
“In the past, venerable sirs, I was
a disciple of the Victor named Sumedha.
I was an ordinary person, without understanding,
and I wandered for seven years.
I, having worshipped the relic of the Conqueror Sumedha,
The Teacher who had attained the end, the one of great patience,
The collection of the Relics covered with a golden net,
I was gladdened in my mind at the Shrine.

original: Na māsi dānaṁ na ca matthi dātuṁ,
analyzed: na māsi dānam na ca matthi dātu
translated: I did not give a gift, nor did I have one given,
But I did encourage others to give there;
‘Worship the Relics of the One Worthy of Worship,
In this way you will go to the heavenly world.’

analyzed: tat eva kammam kusalam katam mayā
translated: That good deed was done by me,
I experience heavenly bliss by myself;
I rejoice in the midst of the group of the Thirty-three,
I have not yet reached the end of that merit.”
The Eighth Miracle of the Many Coloured Palace.
